summary: This is a certification of business records from FedEx Express, signed by Tracey L. Ferrara as Custodian of Records, verifying that certain documents are original or true copies made in the regular course of business. It is notarized by A.W. (last name unclear) and appears to be part of legal proceedings, likely related to document production in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Tracey L. Ferrara
persons.role: Custodian of Records for FedEx Express Legal Department
persons.context: She is the employee who certifies that the FedEx business records are original or true copies made in the regular course of business.

persons.name: A.W.
persons.context: Notary public who swears in and subscribes the certification document.

events.title: Execution of FedEx Business Records Certification
events.description: Tracey L. Ferrara executes a certification under penalty of perjury that certain FedEx Express documents are original records or true copies made in the regular course of business, and it is sworn before a notary public.

locations: FedEx Express Legal Department, 3620 Hacks Cross Road Building B, Third Floor, Memphis, TN 38125
keyFacts: FedEx Express provided certified business records, likely under subpoena or as part of discovery in legal proceedings related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Tracey L. Ferrara, as Custodian of Records, certified under penalty of perjury that the documents were original or true copies made in the regular course of business.
The certification was executed and notarized on February 21, 2008, indicating the timing of document production.
The document suggests FedEx shipping records were being entered as evidence, possibly related to tracking shipments, communications, or financial transactions in the Epstein case.
